The Tenement Museum in New York is planning to open a new outpost in the city next year. The museum has named the building after the Tenement Museum in Harlem, which is slated to close this fall. The space will be located at 130 Spring Street and will be inaugurated by a performance, an exhibition, a book signing, and a Q&A session, which will be preceded by a tour of the museum.“The new space will be a living museum, with a full-time staff and a permanent collection of American art,” said museum director James Cuno. “While the museum will remain open for visitors to enjoy its expansive galleries and rich exhibition program, the space will also become an important cultural and artistic outpost of Harlem, as a hub for arts and culture.”The institution will also celebrate its fiftieth anniversary this year.
